case_vignette: A 45-year-old man is brought to the trauma bay by emergency services after a motorbike accident in which the patient, who was not wearing a helmet, hit a pole of a streetlight with his head. When initially evaluated by the paramedics, the patient was responsive, albeit confused, opened his eyes spontaneously, and was able to follow commands. An hour later, upon admission, the patient only opened his eyes to painful stimuli, made incomprehensible sounds, and assumed a flexed posture. The vital signs are as follows: blood pressure 140/80 mm Hg; heart rate 59/min; respiratory rate 11/min; temperature 37.0℃ (99.1℉), and SaO2, 95% on room air. The examination shows a laceration and bruising on the left side of the head. There is anisocoria with the left pupil 3 mm more dilated than the right. Both pupils react sluggishly to light. There is an increase in tone and hyperreflexia in the right upper and lower extremities. The patient is intubated and mechanically ventilated, head elevated to 30°, and sent for a CT scan.
question: Which  management strategies should be used in this patient, considering his most probable diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I was responsive but confused after the accident, and now I only open my eyes when I feel pain and can only make sounds that don't make sense.
How old are you?
I am 45 years old.
Do you have any existing medical conditions or are you on any medications?
I haven't mentioned any existing medical conditions or medications that I'm taking.
Do you have a history of seizures?
My medical history hasn't been discussed, so I don't know if I have a history of seizures.
Do you have any family history of neurological disorders?
There's no information shared about my family's medical history.
**Final Diagnosis:** Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI)

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I was in a motorbike accident and now I only open my eyes when something hurts, I'm making sounds that don't make sense, and my body is curling up.
How old are you and what is your gender?
I'm a 45-year-old man.
Do you have a history of seizures or epilepsy?

I can't provide that information.
I understand. Based on your symptoms and history of a motorbike accident, I suspect you may be suffering from a traumatic brain injury. I recommend seeking immediate medical evaluation and treatment.

trial_1.summarized_conversation: A 45-year-old man is brought into the emergency room after a motorbike accident. He is unresponsive and only opens his eyes when in pain, making incomprehensible sounds and curling up his body. There is no history of seizures or epilepsy available.

**Final Diagnosis:** Traumatic brain injury with decerebrate posturing
